info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 5:51PM EDT until July 05 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Davie County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Alexander County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northern Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Caldwell County in western North Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 550 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near East Bend to 7 miles southeast of Deep Gap, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Mocksville, Taylorsville, Gamewell, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Bermuda Run, Stony Point, Harmony and Cedar Rock. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
